intro: Sida trisulcata, commonly known as the three-ribbed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate with three distinct ribs, giving it its common name. Sida trisulcata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
